column4: hi, how can I find out whether Ubuntu is using the correct swap?
df ?
thank you
it seems my swap is not mounted ...
why not it should automount
I don't know why it doesn't mount :(
did you just install?
no. this is 9.04 and I moved the standard "install on one harddrive" swap to another harddrive
sfa1 is a primary partition ithink you did something wrong
well this was working a while ago :(
my swap is 10 igs and sda5
not sure why that information is important to my question ...
bc you mad a whole hdrive swap and didn't partitin correctly
why would you say that?
the UUID is the unique identifier for a partition and yes, I am using a complete partition as my swap drive
pastebin fre -m
http://pastebin.com/hqNH6mmK
your swap is active
seems so .. but why doesn't it show anywhere else?
it will never show in df
why?
dunno
ok, thank you - sleep tight
